column1: Call your doctor if you feel faint, have chest pain, or feel short of breath when you exercise.
Call your doctor if you feel pain or numbness in your feet.
If you take medicines that lower your blood sugar, exercise can make your blood sugar go too low.
Talk to your doctor or nurse about how to take your medicines when you exercise.
Tell coaches and exercise partners that you have diabetes.
You might not feel pain in your feet because of your diabetes.
